title-part.text: MAKING ARTICLES OF PAPER, CARDBOARD OR MATERIAL WORKED IN A MANNER ANALOGOUS TO PAPER, NOT PROVIDED FOR IN SUBCLASSES B31B OR B31C

reference.text: manufacture by dry processes of articles made from particles or fibres consisting of wood or other lignocellulosic or like organic material B27N; making layered products not composed wholly of paper or cardboard B32B; making articles from cellulosic fibrous suspensions, e.g. wood pulp, D21J

title-part.text: Multiple-step processes for making flat articles

CPC-specific-text.text: ; Making flat articles

note.note-paragraph:
Group B31D1/00 is impacted by reclassification into group B31B50/00.
Groups B31D1/00 and B31B50/00 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

the articles being mounting corners for photographs or cards
the articles being pull-tap closure discs for bottles, jars or like containers
Making articles having embedded wires
the articles being paper nettings, e.g. by slitting and expanding webs or sheets
the articles being toilet seat covers

reference.text: toilet seat covers per se A47K13/14

making bottoms or caps
the articles being package fasteners, e.g. tubular bands
the articles being adhesive strips or tape
the articles being saucer or beerglass pads, liners for closing caps or similar articles
by assembling, e.g. by laminating
by attaching individual objects to webs or sheets
the webs or sheets being provided with apertures for the objects, e.g. with means for making the apertures
involving impregnating

title-part.text: the articles being labels or tags

note.note-paragraph: Attaching threads to labels or tags is classified in group B31D1/02, e.g. B31D1/023

CPC-specific-text.text: Making adhesive labels having a multilayered structure, e.g. provided on carrier webs
Label folding
Attaching wires or threads
to labels or tags composed of two layers, the wire or thread being embedded between them
Applying patches, washers or reinforcements
Cutting or perforating
involving, marking, printing or coding

the articles being handles

title-part.text: Making articles of cellular structure, e.g. insulating board

note.note-paragraph:
Group B31D3/00 is impacted by reclassification into group B31B50/00.
Groups B31D3/00 and B31B50/00 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: Methods for making cellular structures; Cellular structures
Making cellular structures from corrugated webs or sheets
by cutting corrugated webs longitudinally into strips, piling these strips and uniting them

title-part.text: honeycombed structures

CPC-specific-text.text: , i.e. the cells having an essentially hexagonal section
of particular shape or construction
for window coverings
Making honeycomb cores, e.g. by piling a plurality of web sections or sheets
by cutting webs longitudinally into strips, piling these strips and uniting them along lines perpendicular to the cuts
involving laminating the expanded core

Plane webs having essentially longitudinal adhesive strips being folded transversely into stacks or being cut transversely into sections which are piled, e.g. zigzag-folding the webs preceding the cutting
involving laminating the expanded core
by applying longitudinal adhesive strips to the web and zig-zag folding the strips transversely
Forming piles by winding a web on a reel
Plane webs having essentially transverse adhesive strips being folded transversely into stacks or being cut transversely into sections which are piled
Laminating honeycomb cores; applying cover sheets to core edges; working core edges
involving auxiliary operations, e.g. expanding, moistening, glue-applying, joining, controlling

title-part.text: cellular packaging articles, e.g. for bottles

note.note-paragraph: Making drinking straws is classified in group B31D5/00, e.g. B31D5/0095

Group B31D5/00 is impacted by reclassification into group B31B50/00.
Groups B31D5/00 and B31B50/00 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group B31D5/04 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group B31D5/0039.

Groups B31D5/04, B31D5/0039, and B31B50/00 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.
